system.biography:
TitleFFF 610-1 Priest Siem
Birthday27 Larane 659
AppearanceAge 60, height 6’, medium frame, weight 170 lb, average appearance, very dark complexion, black hair, hazel eyes
Medical/PsycheNone
Size7
ArmorAverage light blue cloth tunic and leggings, leather shoes and shoulder bag, and knife. He can draw weapons and armour from the arms locker, but only if combat is expected
Other EquipmentBelt pouch
Valuables28d in silver in a money pouch, sewn into the lining of his shoulder bag are three usurers’ notes (value GM’s discretion)
Notes

Biography

Parma is a cleric (such as there are) of Siem. He is a pure blooded Jarin from Arathel. He spent the last few years at the Taur-Im-Aina (Holy Grove) on the “South Downs” of Evael. He seems to be suffering inner torment, showing signs of moral weakness, while teaching a higher standard. A cleric, he’s the older and wiser member of Lorkin's crew. While he has found Siem, he’s not sure if he’s found himself. He wants to see the world again and spread hope. He’s well educated and spends a lot of leisure time with Inara...just to talk, of course.

There is more to Parma then he lets on. In 673TR, Jurri Canjarl led five warboats against Arathel. The island fell without a fight after clanhead Brela Merovyne challenged Jurri Canjarl to personal combat and was slain. Derrial is Jurri’s younger brother. In accordance with his brother’s wishes, he swore an oath of allegiance to Jurri, then Tursi, making him a traitor in the eyes of many Jarin.

Parma is a devout follower of Siem and a member of the Uthriem Roliri from birth. He acted as emissary and agent for the conquering Ivinians, especially in dealings with the Jarin of Arathel and the lords of Leriel, Gwaeryn and Pethwys. During the Jarin Rebellion, to save lives, he spied on several key rebel leaders, at great cost to his own soul. After the rebellion ended, he made a pilgrimage to Evael to repent and beg forgiveness for betraying his own blood. The elves stopped him on their borders and threaten to take away his memories, he replied, "I wish you would!" They allowed him to enter and he spent many years in prayer and meditation in the Holy Groves, finding some measure of forgiveness and peace.

In 719, he was summoned; rumors of the Crimson Dancer’s ‘human experiments’ had reached King Aranath. The Council of Eleven learned that one girl, Kibâ Tam, had been rescued and was on her way to Cherafir. The King asked Parma to watch over her and, if possible, determine what had been done to the girl. Parma boarded the Lorkin in Cherafir. Although he has tried to renounce violence, he occasionally surprises the crew with impressive combat skills. He bears a secret warrant, from the King of Evael, and can identify himself as the uncle of the Valhakar of Clan Cyeen, if absolutely necessary.

ADVENTURE HOOK

Innocent Courier. Parma sends regular coded reports to Evael through various agents in different ports. Lately, because of the Lorkin’s schedule, he has not been able to file a report. He approaches the PCs to transport a simple letter to his cousin in Cherafir. They are going that way anyway. Agents of the Agrikan church try to intercept the letter and kill the PCs.

Credits

This character is taken from “Friends, Foes, and Followers, Vol. 1” on Lythia.com (https://www.lythia.com/game_aides/friends-foes-followers-volume-1/), by Kerry Mould, with illustrations by Richard Luscheck and Juha Makkonen, and is “fanon”, a derivative work of copyrighted material by Columbia Games Inc. and N. Robin Crossby.
